result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cory R. Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cory R. Anderson was found guilty of Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Partial. Sentencing on Revocation, Plea, Sentencing Hearing held on August 20, 2018

9:10  This case includes 16CF5, 16CF6  Defendant Cory R. Anderson in court with attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Walker addresses - Plead to 16CF5 & 16CF6  Confinement.   18 mon   2 1/2 yrs ES  18CF132 18 months confinement  2 1/2  yrs ES    The Judge addresses the defendant regarding his right to request another Judge because Judge Boles knows the defendant through the drug court.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge.  The defendant addresses the court. The Court orders. 3/12 yrs prison -  18 months confinement and 2   yrs ES on 18CF132.  16CF5 and 16CF6 on each case 18 months Confinement and 2  yrs ES concurrent to each other and concurrent to the sentence on 18CF132.    124 Days credit.   DNA sample and surcharge on 18CF132  Conditions of ES are :   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.  Absolute sobriety.  Comply with any programs the agent  requires defendant to complete.  Pay court costs that were previously ordered on 16CF5 and 16+CF6   Earned release and Challenge Incarceration are allowed.  9:40
from Probation/Parole Agent Tricia Rouleau re: objects to request for furlough.
from Judge Boles to Cory Anderson's furlough request " Request Denied. Judge Boles".
from Cory Anderson asking for a furlough to attend Recovery Maiden Rock Campout from June 15-17.

1:13 Defendant Cory R. Anderson in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Defendant Cory R. Anderson in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF6 heard at this time. Probation Agent Tricia Rouleau appears in court via phone. Atty Walker: 60 days conditional jail on both files for violations, requested by agent. State agrees. Atty Amann responses; less jail so Def can keep his employment, requests work release. Agent Rouleau addresses the court and requests the 60 days jail, objects to work release.  Defendant addresses the court. Court orders 60 days on each case. Release June 19, 2018. 1:29
from Probation Agent Tricia Rouleau re: Def's relapse and asking for 60 days conditional jail time.
Probation review hearing on May 2, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 10:31 Also 14CF176 & 16CF6 Defendant Cory R. Anderson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Cory R. Anderson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF5 amended information filed. Plead to amended charge. 16CF6 plead to count 3. Probation of 3 years on each count concurrent. Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights 16CF5 Amended Count Poession of Meth, 16CF5 Count 3   DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty 16CF5 Count 1 & 2  are dismissed. 02:23 16CF6 also heard at this time. Defendant Cory R. Anderson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Cory R. Anderson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed for both cases and the court reviews with the defendant.   Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 09:15 am.

02:26 16CF6 also heard at this tim.  Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information. Defendant pleas not guilty to all counts.    Not guilty plea received by the court.   Pretrial Conference to be set
Liesl Nelson

Defendant Cory R. Anderson appears via videoconferencing from PC Jail w/Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court.  ADA William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 16CF5 & 16CF6.  Cases called at 4:07 p.m.  Court advises Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands.  ADA Thorie advises Defendant is on PO hold and requests cash bond.  Atty. Nelson states since Defendant is on a PO hold she does not object to modest cash bond.  Court sets $500 cash bond on each case.  Court advises of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Atty. Nelson requests set.  Court advises of bond conditions.  Court confirms address, dob and phone.  Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 01-22-2016 02:15 pm.
